content:
**Which graph shows a linear function with domain $x\geq5$?**


[[â˜ƒ radio 1]]

choices.content: ![A ray of a linear function is graphed. The x and g of x axes go from negative 10 to 10. There is a filled circle at the point (5, 4). There is a line extending from this point upwards and to the right terminating in an arrow at the end of the graph.](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/c816b2f9b31acb759b81da1b6694dff953d6437b)

![A ray of a linear function is graphed. The x and g of x axes go from negative 10 to 10. There is an open, unfilled circle at the point (5, 4). There is a line extending from this point upwards and to the right terminating in an arrow at the end of the graph.](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/be8641c14b0c205e290fe37be83c18f3d095d5ca)

![A ray of a linear function is graphed. The x and g of x axes go from negative 10 to 10. There is an open, unfilled circle at the point (5, 4). There is a line extending from this point downwards and to the left terminating in an arrow at the end of the graph.](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/3a642e99d2941834d57e69e77ada4c3a62c173f1)

![A ray of a linear function is graphed. The x and g of x axes go from negative 10 to 10. There is a filled circle at the point (5, 4). There is a line extending from this point downwards and to the left terminating in an arrow at the end of the graph.](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/322a38d0b4e7d9401a2704b9f0f5fbf352938e94)
